pros:
Interesting patient experiences. 
Will become exposed to all aspects of healthcare depending on which area you work in.
cons:
Salary is too low for the amount of stress involved.
No repercussions for violations of company policy. 
HR is non responsive.
Difficult to move around, or upwards in the hierarchy. Typical corporate politics at play. 
Management makes decisions that they don't have to execute themselves, preventing them from being exposed to the reality of their terrible policies.
Talented employees are trapped in monotonous jobs.

pros: Work life balance, not so busy, people are nice, work time is flexible, allow many sick days, work place is in downtown
cons: Salary is too low, not so many chances to learn new things, supervisor had no incentive to teach, ngo has no incentive to raise wage

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Carol Stream, IL
pros: Very nice people, great work environment
cons: Very busy, but monotonous work, intense metrics. Have to wait 6 months before you can advance or move into another role.

review_title: Heard good things but experience was not great.
pros: Give you a 45 min lunch break, and some management is kind while others are just rude.
cons: The management doesn't stand up to the employees that are disrespectful.

pros: Great coworkers - dedicated, friendly staff.  Good location, easily accessible by public transportation.  Great health insurance.
cons: Upper management is out of touch and consumed by the bottom line.  Sweeping organizational changes are made with no consideration for the staff and with very little communication.

pros: Supportive environment and excellent care, facilities and staff. Truly strive for the best!
cons: I can't say enough good things about this place. The only possible con, there is limited opportunities to move up in management and there is mostly men in senior VP roles.

pros:
Competitive salary.
Work life balance.
Annual bonuses when you help meet their goals.
Annual wellness allowance.
Fast pace (pro and con).
Management is understanding so long as one keeps them in the loop of personal issues.
Management will mentor/counsel/teach a rep who is struggling with the work load.
cons:
High turnover in department.
Fast pace (pro and con).
High work load.

pros: Consistent top pay, great benefits, great people to work with, inclusive envrionment.
cons: You have to speak up for your worth, they will try to "nickel & dime" you on pay. Typical corporate policies can sometimes be frustrating - but it is workable.

review_title: If you want a good job come to Northwestern Memorial Hospital.
pros: Great Benefits. Tuition reimbursement, Room to expand in other departments.
cons: My department has a no fault policy. Sometimes I feel there is favortism. Otherwise this is a very good oppurtunity

review_title: Corporate,  Process Improvement Oriented Healthcare Org
job_title: Program Manager, IT in Chicago, IL
pros: Have most resources needed to do a good job
cons:
Leadership team can be very arrogant and not open to constructive feedback - although it's said they want to hear it.  Feels like departments are very defensive when working through problems. 
Superficial relationships

pros: Great people to work with!  Co-workers support each other.   Flexible schedule, was able to self schedule.  Fast paced enviroment
cons: Overworked, stressful.  Upper management does not value employees.  Poor orientation which creates a dangerous environment.   COncerns are not addressed.  Large turnover

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Chicago, IL
pros: Good company to work for, many locations, and great pay
cons: Management can be hit or miss

pros: Great benefits; good internal professional development opportunities and tuition assistance for external education; overall good people to work with on a daily basis
cons: Hierarchical environment, which is challenging to advance and communicate needed change; not all leaders have education or experience on leading people

review_title: Changed the way I feel about nursing, not for the better either.
job_title: RN Float Pool in Chicago, IL
pros: Currently if you like to work overtime, you can work as much as you like
cons: No PCT, NO RT,NO cap on the amount of patients you can care for.

pros: Great company to work for.  Positive working environment with management, and great interaction with co-workers.  Enjoyed my stay there!  I highly recommend working there!
cons: I worked there as a contractor.  So, downside was that I was not able to continue working there as a full-time employee.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Chicago, IL
pros:
Excellent Benefits
Great Location 
Education Reimbursement
Training Programs 
An opportunity to really grow with this hospital and gain skills for everyday life.
cons: No help if you don't get something. I personally kept asking questions and writing things down, it seemed to be held against me.

job_title: Transplant Data Specialist in Chicago, IL
pros: The salary and benefits are good. They pay more than most hospitals/healthcare systems in the Chicago area..
cons: The bonus structure changed. At one point, everyone received the same bonus amount. Now it is based on length of employment. So that's good for some and bad for others.

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Chicago, IL
pros: I work in the specialty department which was easier, I heard if you work in primary it’s really tough.
cons: Over all I love this job, my team, managers, perks and the pay.

review_title: Lack of engagement in teams and leadership
pros:
-Reputation in Chicago
-Nice clinical managers
cons:
-Far commute from the suburbs and need to pay for a shuttle
-Not engaged employees or managers within corporate teams
-Salaries low
-Not a lot of levels or advancement within a department

review_title: It has been such a wonderfu, inspiring experience after the beat-down from my previous corporate experience.
pros: The inspiration to be your best and get awarded for your hard work.
cons: The commute from my house.

review_title: Great environment to learn as a new grad nurse.
pros: Excellent and approachable leadership, decent benefits, easy access and definite support for career advancement.
cons: They know they can pay their employees less because everyone wants to work there.

review_title: I am honored to work for such a great organization!! Great opportunity!!
pros: Wonderful people to work with
cons: Dealing with upset patients and family member's demanding to speak with the President of Northwestern. Also Had to learn how to make the best protocol to make the patients and family members happy.

review_title: A lot of work for such low pay.
job_title: Billing Clerk in Saint Charles, IL
pros: The fellow employees are great. It's like working with a big, friendly family. Nice, clean, quiet environment to get work done.
cons: The pay is so low for the amount of work - it's insulting! Not so friendly management. Not so friendly human resources.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Winfield, IL
pros: Good health insurance, big company so opportunities to transfer to another department.
cons: More work than 1 person could possibly handle.  Micromanaging boss.  Had to get another employee to agree to take on your work so you could have a day off.

pros: Easy to get a job as a new grad, great night shift differential, easy to get to day shift.
cons: Upper management not supportive of nursing, a lot of turn around in staff, minimal orientation and education benefits.

pros: I've seen these talented people perform miracles.
cons: At the upper acquisition level, it's not bad.  Almost everywhere else it was like a poor fire drill.

pros: Plenty of room for advancement, fun location, knowledgeable co-workers, challenging and endless variety of opportunities, excellent health insurance benefits
cons: Don't pay as much as many hospitals in the area, long commute if you live in the suburbs, skeleton staff on weekends and high turnover

pros: Great benefits, good pay, work at the top of your nursing license and profession, given a lot of freedom and autonomy within scope of practice
cons: Don't get to set your hours/days on some floors, work every other weekend, no guaranteed vacation or PTO

review_title: Great Platform for growth in the healthcare industry

pros: Great benefits, opportunity to work with top professionals in all disciplines.  A culture of respect.  Given a great deal of independence
